intro: Yinshania zhejiangensis, commonly known as the Zhejiang yinshania, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often vibrant flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
